incidents.name: Platform Service Degradation - Increased Latency and High Error Rates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating reports of degraded performance across our platform.

incidents.name: Degraded Supavisor performance in sa-east-1 region.

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved.

The impact began at 2:00 UTC causing a small fraction of queries in the affected region to be slower.
At 11:00 UTC, the issue escalated and became more apparent as p95 latency increased.
By 15:00 UTC, the degradation became widespread, with median query performance showing high variance and p95 consistently elevated.

Higher than usual connection times could also be perceived during the incident.
We identified and replaced a faulty node in the sa-east-1 region. We are seeing query and connection times return to normal and will continue to monitor.
We are investigating degraded supavisor performance in the sa-east-1 region.

incidents.name: Degraded Management API performance in EU and US regions.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Management API performance has stabilized in EU and US regions, though some write requests may experience slightly elevated latency. We continue to monitor for sporadic spikes while implementing additional improvements to ensure full stability.

Management API performance has largely stabilized in EU and US regions. However, we are still observing sporadic latency spikes and occasional errors. Our team continues to work on a permanent fix to fully resolve the issue.

We’ve rebalanced request traffic to stabilise the service. Initial indicators look healthy.
We’ll continue to monitor over the next few hours to ensure the issue remains resolved.

We are experiencing degraded Management API performance in EU and US regions. 
As a result users may experience dashboard latency and increased error rates.

Existing projects are not impacted

components.name: Management API
components.description: Manage Supabase projects programmatically.

incidents.name: Elevated query latency and connection times for Shared Pooler in us-west-1

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've implemented a fix. Both query latency and connection times have returned to normal values. We continue to monitor the situation to ensure the issue is fully resolved.

We are currently experiencing elevated p99 query latency and increased connection times for Shared Pooler users in the us-west-1 region. Our team is actively investigating the issue and working toward a resolution.

components.name: Connection Pooler
components.description: Supavisor is a cloud-native, multi-tenant Postgres connection pooler.

incidents.name: Regional outage: Service disruption in us-east-1 (N. Virginia)

incident_updates.body: The upstream issues have been resolved, and we are seeing normal behavior across the fleet now. We've re-enabled platform level operations, and all systems looking stable.

We have received reports from users experiencing issues with the dashboard as well as some in-dashboard actions.

While our core infrastructure and APIs remain healthy, these issues are linked to an ongoing incident affecting services hosted in the us-east-1 region, where our dashboard infrastructure and a subset of our APIs are distributed in.
This may impact users globally, including those with projects outside of that region.
We’re monitoring the situation closely and will provide updates as the upstream provider resolves the incident.

Thank you for your patience.

We are currently seeing elevated error rates from our cloud provider’s API in the us-east-1 region.

To safeguard existing projects, we have temporarily paused all platform-level operations in this region, including the creation of new projects.

incidents.name: Upstream provider issue affecting repo sync in US-EAST-1 (N. Virginia)

incident_updates.body:
We’re closing this incident in favour of the higher-impact event now tracked here: status.supabase.com/incidents/595nsxm9hj59. 
Please follow that incident for further updates.

We’re seeing impact in US-EAST-1 (N. Virginia) due to an upstream provider issue. 
GitHub pushes are not syncing to existing branches. 
You can still create new projects and branches, but new branches will start in an empty state as they will not be synced from GitHub. 
Once the issue is resolved, please push again to bring affected branches up to date.

incidents.name: Project and branch lifecycle workflows affected in EU and APAC regions

incident_updates.body:
We are no longer observing capacity issues with our cloud provider, and there have been no capacity related errors with new project creation, restores, restarts, or upgrades in the past 24 hours.

Some projects remain stuck and require manual intervention. Our team is actively working through these requests.

We are currently experiencing capacity issues across all EU and APAC regions due to a surge in project creation requests.
This is impacting the availability of Nano and Micro instance types. Larger compute sizes are not impacted. 
Note: Branches are deployed as Micro by default, so branching from larger compute sizes may be impacted. 

As a result, users may encounter errors when attempting the following operations on a Nano or Micro instance:
- Project creation
- Project restore
- Project restart
- Project resize
- Unpausing projects 
- Database upgrade
- Read replica creation
- Branch creation

We are continuously monitoring available capacity across all regions and will enable or disable project and branch lifecycle workflows (listed above) as needed based on current capacity.

At this time, these workflows are enabled in all regions.

Existing active projects in the region remain unaffected.

incidents.name: Supabase Connectivity from the Etisalat and Du network in the UAE

incident_updates.body:
Between September 2nd and September 20th, 2025, customers in the UAE experienced service outages when attempting to access Supabase projects. The issue was caused by DNS-level blocking implemented by major UAE telecommunications providers Etisalat and Du, citing copyright infringement concerns related to unauthorized usage of our platform.

Customers with projects accessed from within the UAE were completely unable to reach any `*.supabase.co` domains. The blocking affected all Supabase services including PostgREST, Auth, Storage, Realtime, and Edge Functions.

We sincerely apologize for the extended disruption this caused to your applications and services. Here is additional detail about what happened and the steps we're taking to prevent similar incidents.

## What happened?

UAE telecommunications providers Etisalat and Du implemented DNS-level blocking of all `*.supabase.co` domains after identifying a project that violated broadcasting rights in the region. The providers did not send advance notice or DMCA takedown requests, instead implementing immediate network-wide blocking for all Supabase domains.

The incident timeline was as follows:

* **MON 2 SEP 18:00 UTC**: Initial customer reports of connectivity issues from UAE
* **MON 2 SEP 23:30 UTC**: Identified DNS blocking by Etisalat, began outreach attempts
* **TUE 3 to FRI 13 SEP**: Sent multiple formal and informal communications to ISP NOC contacts
* **WED 10 SEP**: Deployed proxy workaround with limited functionality as last resort measure
* **SUN 15 SEP**: Our partners were able to reach out directly to Etisalat and worked with them to facilitate unblock
* **SUN 15 SEP**: Engaged UAE law firm to handle official TDRA communication
* **MON 16 SEP**: Our customer facilitated introduction to TDRA
* **TUE 17 SEP**: Etisalat connectivity restored following TDRA intervention
* **WED 18 SEP**: TDRA provided details of copyright violations, offending project suspended
* **THU 19 SEP**: Du confirmed working on removal of restrictions
* **FRI 20 SEP**: Full connectivity restored across all UAE ISPs

## What will we do to mitigate problems like this in the future?

* We have established forward looking proactive strategy with government authorities in the UAE.
* We are working on a strategy for further proactive regulator engagement.
* Make abuse reporting channels more visible on our website.

## What actions do you need to take?

If you previously switched to a proxy as a workaround, please migrate back to your original `*.supabase.co` domain as the proxy solution has limited functionality and is not intended for long-term use.

If you experience any lingering connectivity issues from UAE networks, please contact our support team with your project details and ISP information.
This incident has been resolved.

Both Etisalat and Du connectivity have been restored. Multiple customers confirm access to `*.supabase.co` domains is working normally across both ISPs. We are monitoring the situation to ensure stability. Thank you for your patience during this incident.

We have made significant progress with Etisalat after establishing contact with both Etisalat and TDRA (UAE Telecommunications Regulatory Authority). Multiple customers confirm Etisalat connectivity is restored.

TDRA provided details about the block and has removed restrictions for `*.supabase.co` domains. We are taking the required actions per their guidance.

We are still working to confirm Du has implemented the same changes. If you’re on Du and experiencing issues, please contact support directly.

We are still awaiting formal responses from Etisalat and Du despite multiple escalation attempts. We are now pursuing alternative channels of engagement with them. If your customers are primarily located in the UAE, please contact support directly. VPN/proxy connections continue working.

We have also received reports of network connectivity issues for users on the Du network in the UAE. We have contacted both Etisalat and Du and are looking forward to working with them both to resolve this as soon as possible. In the interim, connections via VPN, proxy, or from other networks appear to be unaffected.

We are still waiting for a response from the Etisalat ISP to resolve the connectivity issues in the UAE. We have reached out to them via multiple channels and are trying to restore connectivity as soon as possible. In the interim, connections via VPN, proxy, or from other networks appear to be unaffected.

We have received reports that users on the Etisalat network in the UAE are unable to connect to Supabase. We have reached out to Etisalat and will work with them to restore connectivity as soon as possible. In the interim, connections via VPN or from other networks appear to be unaffected.

If you still have issues with Realtime connections, please reach out to support.

We are currently investigating this issue.

Running projects should not be affected.

incidents.name: Elevated 525 error rates in the US region

incident_updates.body:
## SSL Handshake Failures Due to BGP Route Leak

Between 9:15 UTC and 11:09 UTC on August 28th, 2025, customers accessing Supabase services in the us-east-1 region experienced SSL handshake failures \(525 errors\) when connecting to their projects. The issue was caused by a third-party network route leak that misdirected traffic intended for AWS prefixes.

Customers with projects hosted in the us-east-1 region were primarily affected. In total, over 5 million requests were blocked. The impacted requests received Cloudflare 525 and 520 errors, primarily affecting PostgREST and Auth services.

We sincerely apologize for the disruption this caused to your applications and services. Here is additional detail about what happened and the steps we're taking to improve our resilience against similar incidents.

### What happened?

A third-party network provider unintentionally propagated BGP routing announcements beyond their intended scope, causing a route leak that included AWS prefixes used by Supabase origins. This misdirected traffic away from its proper destination, resulting in SSL handshake failures at our CDN layer.

The incident timeline was as follows:

* WED 28 AUG 9:18 UTC: Multiple customer in us-east support tickets reported 525 and 520 errors
* WED 28 AUG 9:20 UTC: We started an internal incident
* WED 28 AUG 9:25 UTC: Our team identified the issue was concentrated in us-east-1 region and reached out to our upstream provider
* WED 28 AUG 9:50 UTC: Issue was confirmed to be related to external network/CDN problem
* WED 28 AUG 10:35 UTC: US traffic began recovering as BGP routes stabilized
* WED 28 AUG 11:09 UTC: Full recovery confirmed, error rates returned to zero
* WED 29 AUG 9:40 UTC: We were continuing to work with an upstream provider until the identification of the root cause

### What will we do to mitigate problems like this in the future?

* Improve detection and alerting
* Improve vendor communication to be able to faster detect similar issues in the future

### What actions do you need to take?

No action is required from customers. This was an infrastructure issue outside of Supabase's direct control that has been resolved. The BGP route leak was corrected by the third-party network provider, and traffic routing has returned to normal.

If you continue to experience connectivity issues, please contact our support team with details about your specific project and region.
This incident has been resolved.
The error rates are back to normal and all systems are fully operational now. We will continue to monitor to make sure the issue doesn’t arise again.

We are observing that error rates are going down. Though they still remain at a higher level than usual. 

We are continuing the work with the upstream provider as well as monitor impact on our side.
We're seeing high 525 error rates for API requests in the US region. We currently believe there may be a problem with our upstream networking partner and are looking to validate.

We've spotted high error rates for some of the API requests. We made a temporary fix that prevents access to saved queries and folders. We are actively working on getting things back to normal and turning this functionality back on.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue was resolved and we are fully back to normal. We will monitor to make sure the problem doesn’t come back.
Our measures solved the majority of issues and most of the queued jobs have now been successfully run. We are still working on the clearing up the last batch of the jobs remaining in the queue.

incidents.name: Degraded logs querying performance

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Things have been stable for a while now. There is still a backlog of logs, so some logs may continue to be delayed until things catch up, but all processes looking nominal now.

We are seeing stable log queries from the dashboard now. There may be delays in logs appearing or possibly missing logs from the duration of the incident. We are currently assessing that now that things are looking more stable.

We have identified a few issues. Some fixes have gone out and the team is working on others. Things are stabilizing, and error rates are reducing; however, they are not entirely solved. But folks should be seeing improvements in logging in the dashboard now. We'll continue to update as the situation continues to improve.

We are still working on resolving the issue. We are deploying a new version of Logflare that can solve one of the underlying causes.

Please note that Edge Functions (and all other services) are fully operational, but as logs are degraded, you will not be able to see their logs in the dashboard.

We have identified possible underlying issues, and our engineers work hard on mitigation measures. We have balanced some queries to an additional cluster and limited queries with high resources consumption to be available only for teams and enterprise tier customers. We are still working on immediate steps solve the problem and will post updates as soon as we are able to mitigate the issue.
We are experiencing degraded logs querying performance. Our team is aware of the issue and is already implementing mitigation issues. Logs ingestion is unaffected.

incidents.name: Increase in error rates for Edge Functions in us-east-1

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Error rates have recovered to within a normal range, and we're continuing to monitor.

The team is still hard at work on identifying the root cause of increased errors in us-east-1, and we hope to restore full functionality to the region soon. In the meantime, a workaround may be to select a region for invocation to avoid us-east-1. Instructions for that can be found here: https://supabase.com/docs/guides/functions/regional-invocation
The team is still looking for the exact cause of the issues in us-east-1, and is continuing to narrow down possible causes.
The team is still investigating the intermittent issues in the us-east-1 region. We've got some promising leads, and hope to have a solution soon.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Intermittent Supavisor connectivity issues for some users.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have deployed the fix, and are monitoring for any further issues.

The most affected regions were: us-east-2 and ap-south-1, both of which have been fixed.
Deployment is ongoing, but the most-affected regions have been fixed. We are seeing some remaining errors in other regions, but very few. The fix will be on all regions shortly.

We have already merged a fix for this, but users may see connectivity issues while the fix is deployed.

Affected regions are: 

ap-south-1
ap-northeast-1,2
eu-west-1,3
us-east-2
ca-central-1
eu-north-1
eu-central-2

incidents.name: Elevated Error rates in Edge functions in all regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
All regions back to stable. We are continuing to monitor in case any new issues arise.
Most regions are back to normal; however we are still seeing instability in euc-1, apse-1, and apse-2, us-west-1, and sa-east-1. The team is focusing their efforts on getting these regions back now.
The fix is holding, and error rates are continuing to return to baseline levels. We are still seeing slightly increased error rates in euc1, apse1, and apse2 while we continue to ramp access back up.
We've identified the issue and pushed a fix. We are gradually re-enabling traffic across all regions, and error rates are declining. We will continue to update periodically as we re-enable traffic.
The team is still investigating the cause of the errors across all regions. We will provide further information as we are able.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: JWT Re-rolls have been re-enabled.

incidents.name: Investigating issues with connectivity via all API endpoints

incident_updates.body:
## Incident Summary

**Date:** 2025-06-12

**Service Impacted:** Supabase Platform \(Multiple Services\)

**Affected Region\(s\):** Global

**Duration:** ~2 hours 25 minutes \(18:05–20:30 UTC\)

Between 18:05 UTC and 20:30 UTC on June 12, 2025, Supabase services experienced widespread degradation caused by an outage in our upstream provider’s infrastructure. The outage impacted the majority of HTTP and Websocket traffic to Supabase APIs globally.

Direct Postgres and connection pooler access remained unaffected.

### Who was affected?

* All Supabase users interacting with the platform or projects via HTTP or WebSocket, including:

    * Auth, Storage, Edge Functions, and Data APIs \(via API Gateway\)
    * Dashboard operations \(partial functionality\)
    * Realtime/WebSocket connections
    * Logging and observability
    

### What happened?

Supabase relies on the upstream provider for proxying, DNS and routing across our platform services and user projects. On June 12, a bug in their Cloud Provider’s infrastructure caused Workers KV storage to fail cascading across their systems.

This caused Supabase’s API Gateway to stop responding, leading to major service degradation as it is an entry point for the vast majority of HTTP and WebSocket traffic.

**Incident timeline \(UTC\):**

* **18:17** — Internal alert triggered: HTTP APIs, Dashboard, WebSocket traffic degraded.
* **18:28** — Incident declared. Logging in into our provider dashboard wasn't working, we opened a support ticket with them and started a conversation about the root cause and ETA for the fix.
* **18:36** — We observe timeouts from the Management API globally.
* **18:45–19:05** — Spike of Management API requests affected internal middleware DB, we took measures to return it to healthy state.
* **19:05–19:13** — Trialled bypass proxy mitigation.
* **20:09** — Provider systems began recovering.
* **20:20** — We retried platform operations that failed during downtime.
* **20:30** — Supabase services begin to stabilize as upstream infrastructure recovers.
* **21:18** — Supabase moves incident status to “Monitoring”.
* **22:05** — Incident closed; services confirmed operational.

### Why did it happen?

* The root cause was an issue within the infrastructure of Cloudflare’s upstream cloud provider.
* This took down multiple their services, including KV which is a key service for them.
* Supabase services affected due to heavy reliance on upstream provider:

    * API Gateway failure blocked access to HTTP APIs and WebSocket.
    * Management API and Dashboard affected due to proxy dependency and API Gateway dependency.
    * Logflare degraded limiting observability due to the cloud provider issues.
    

### What did we do during the incident?

* Opened support communications with Cloudflare immediately.
* Coordinated response across teams and set up fallback comms channels.
* Attempted mitigations while awaiting upstream recovery.
* Paused billing exports and resumed after stability.
* Recovered internal middleware systems affected by retry spikes.

### What will we do to prevent this in future?

1. Migrate critical services away from single points of failure in provider infrastructure.
2. Continue work on API Gateway redesign for isolation and resilience.
3. Improve logging and observability tooling to survive upstream outages.
4. Update internal incident comms processes to reflect global outages accurately and quickly.
5. Engage with the upstream provider for earlier notification of high-impact changes/issues.
6. Tune circuit breakers and alerts for Management API and similar workloads.

### What actions do users need to take?

No action required. This incident was caused by upstream infrastructure failure. All services have returned to normal.

### Conclusion

This was a serious outage that significantly impacted Supabase customers. While the root cause lay with our upstream provider, our own dependencies and architecture contributed to the extent of the disruption. We’ve identified concrete steps to mitigate future incidents, including reducing dependency on single infrastructure points and improving our internal and external communication during outages.

We’re grateful for the patience and understanding of our community and remain committed to building a more resilient and transparent platform.
This incident has been resolved.

Our upstream provider is reporting that all services have been restored and are operational. We are also seeing greatly improved error rates which have returned to baseline. We will continue to monitor for any further issues.

Our upstream provider's services are recovering quickly around the globe. We are seeing improvement in error rates, and systems get back to operational. We are continuing to monitor and will post updates as we have more information.

Our upstream provider still says that errors across their services are intermittent. We are still seeing slow improvement in error rates, but they do remain elevated. We are continuing to monitor and will post updates as we have additional information.

Our upstream provider still says that errors across their services are intermittent; however, we are seeing error rates returning to normal levels. We are continuing to keep an eye on things and will provide more updates as information becomes available.

We believe connectivity issues are the result of a broad outage with our upstream provider. We are currently working with them, and they are posting updates to their own status page here: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/25r9t0vz99rp

We are seeing widespread reports of connectivity issues across all regions. We suspect an issue in an upstream provider given the scope; however we are currently investigating. We will post updates here as they become available.

incidents.name: Signin with Apple issues due to JWT issuer change

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We will continue to monitor problems with Apple sign-in throughout the day as we anticipate further changes by Apple’s OIDC infrastructure.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Projects that are using Sign In with Apple have received an update addressing the problem.
We've identified the cause, and are rolling out a fix on all projects currently using Sign in with Apple.
We are investigating reports of Sign in with Apple not working due to unexpected JWT issuer URL change on Apple’s side.

components.name: Auth
components.description: Authenticate and authorize users

incidents.name: Dashboard Support Form Erroring on ticket submission

incident_updates.body:
The increased retry intervals have made ticket opening much more stable, and things are looking good. 

We apologize for the inconvenience!

We've identified a race condition in the ticket submission process. We've added some resiliency here to avoid the race condition and handle failures more gracefully. This has been merged and we are monitoring the results.

Some users are seeing failures when attempting to submit a support ticket via the dashboard or via https://supabase.help - We are currently investigating.

In the mean time, you can also email us at support@supabase.com - please include the relevant project id for the project or projects you are seeing issues with.

incidents.name: Regression prevents ALTER ROLE usage in projects running PostgreSQL 17

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We've implemented a fix for the issue, which is now in effect for all newly created projects as of 00:00 UTC. We are currently rolling out the fix to existing projects and will provide another update once the rollout is complete.

We have identified a regression affecting projects running PostgreSQL 17 that prevents ALTER ROLE statements from executing successfully against database roles. This issue may impact workflows that rely on role configuration changes.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Logs and Reports unavailable in the Supabase Dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Our engineers have implemented a fix for this issue and log ingestion should resume again, we will continue monitoring for the next hour.

We have identified an issue in our logging pipeline for requests from the APAC and AMER regions. This is affecting ingestion of logs for our DataAPI, Storage, Auth and Edge Function products. Our team is working with our API Gateway provider to resolve the issue.

We have observed failures in our logging pipeline, customers projects may not be receiving logs from our API Gateway provider from requests originating from some regions. Our engineers are investigating and working with our partners to resolve this issue.

incidents.name: supabase-js client lib JSR issue in Edge Functions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues with Edge Function deployments
A fix has been deployed and we are monitoring Edge Function deploys.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

The team has identified an issue with the latest version of supabase-js from JSR in Edge Functions.

A fix has been identified and is being worked on.

In the meantime, you can apply the following mitigations to maintain normal functionality:
* use version 2.49.8 of the library
* use import { createClient } from "npm:@supabase/supabase-js@2"
